intro: Columnea fendleri, commonly known as the red-tipped columnar plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant red or orange flowers with a distinctive red-tipped corolla, often attracting hummingbirds and other pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Columnea fendleri is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and unique floral display.
